item.title: Pavement damage, 28th November
item.description:
Continue down Groombridge Close, turn right onto Tyrell Avenue, Huge uneven flooring with multiple trip hazards on left hand side pavement on Tyrell avenue. Difficult to see in the dark, trip hazard as well as risk of serious injury due to the sharp angles of lifted up pavement. Looks even bigger/worse than the photo implies. Believed to be caused by roadworks lorry tyre a few weeks ago

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tyrrell Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two chairs dumped on grass verge, 28th November
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Diverted Traffic, 28th November
item.description:
On the pavement at the junction of Cassland Rd and Terrace Rd is a yellow "diverted traffic "sign. It's been there for months. I've reported it 5 times. I received a reply from Hackney council saying it would be removed. It is still there.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Terrace Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover on Acton street creating excessive noise pollution, 28th November
item.description:
The newly installed road manhole covers are creating excessive noise pollution every time a vehicle passes over them. We can hear them every 5-10 seconds during the day. This is causing significant disturbance to residents 24/7 and requires immediate attention. We need this resolved as a matter of priority, please, as the current situation is unacceptable and unsustainable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Acton Street, King's Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
